title: How to Make Jacob's Ladder out of String

steps.title: Cut a length of string or yarn.
steps.content: Cut a length of string or yarn. The string should be twice as long as the distance between your shoulders. Another way to measure is by wrapping the string around your elbow and hand about two times.

steps.title: Tie the string ends together.
steps.content: Tie the string ends together. Secure the string in a square knot so it won't pull loose. Use a square knot and cut off the excess when the string is tight.

steps.title: Position your thumb and pinky.
steps.content: Position your thumb and pinky. Start with the string across your palm in an open position. Your thumb and pinky should be looped by the string. Your three middle fingers should stay out. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Hook your right index finger.
steps.content: Hook your right index finger. Guide your finger through the string in front of your three left fingers. Return your right hand to its original position. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Hook your left index finger.
steps.content: Hook your left index finger. Guide your finger through the string directly under your right index finger. Return your left hand to its original position. Hold the string taut between your two hands. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Drop the thumb strings.
steps.content: Drop the thumb strings. There should now be four strings running between your hands. There will only be one “X” between your hands. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Hook your thumbs under the farthest string.
steps.content: Hook your thumbs under the farthest string. You’ll need to be careful only to hook the last string away from you under the rest of the strings. Bring your hands back to the original position. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Hook another string with your thumbs.
steps.content: Hook another string with your thumbs. Move your thumbs over the first string on your index finger, and hook them beneath the second string on your index fingers. Return to the original position.

steps.title: Drop the pinky strings.
steps.content: Drop the pinky strings. Make sure only to drop the strings wrapped around your pinkies. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Hook a string with your pinkies.
steps.content: Hook a string with your pinkies. Move your pinkies over the last string and under the adjacent string. Return your hands to the original position.

steps.title: Drop the thumb strings.
steps.content: Drop the thumb strings. This creates the Cat's Whiskers position. You should only have the string looped around your pinky and index fingers. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Hook your thumb under the third string.
steps.content: Hook your thumb under the third string. Put your thumbs over the two strings on your index fingers. Then carefully position them under the first string on your pinky fingers. You should now have loops around your pinkies, index fingers and thumbs. [8] X Research source Try not to pull too tight. You want a little tension but not too much.

steps.title: Use your left hand.
steps.content: Use your left hand. Take the loop on your right index finger and place it over your thumb. The top loop should be on both your right thumb and right index finger. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Pull up the "bottom" loop.
steps.content: Pull up the "bottom" loop. On your right thumb, use your same hand to position the bottom string on your thumb over your thumb. You should see a small triangle form between your right index finger and thumb.

steps.title: Repeat this on your opposite hand.
steps.content: Repeat this on your opposite hand. Now use your left hand to pull your index loop over your thumb. Then take the bottom string on your thumb over your thumb. You should now have one string over each thumb. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Complete the ladder.
steps.content: Complete the ladder. You’ll need to do a complex move to finish the ladder. This part trips people up, so take it slowly. You’re going turn your hands so they face away from you while doing two things. Put your index fingers through the two small triangles next to your index and thumb. As you flip your hands 180 degrees around, take your pinkies out of their loops. [11] X Research source The second loop around your index fingers should go away, as well. You now have Jacob's Ladder!
